Title: Gyokeres Ends Goal Drought to Send Arsenal to Premier League Summit
Summary: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta said his side have to learn to kill games off while they are winning . Arsenal reclaimed top spot in the Premier League with a 1-0 win at Everton .

Title: Lagos housewife fakes own kidnap to extort ₦2.5m from husband
Summary: Lagos State Police Command has arrested a 26-year-old housewife and her 30-year old accomplice for allegedly staging her own kidnapping and extorting N2.5 million from her husband . Confirming the arrest in a statement issued on Saturday, the Command’s spokesperson, SP, SP.

Title: Pressure on Morocco to deliver as Africa Cup of Nations kicks off Rabat, Morocco
Summary: Morocco carry a huge weight of expectation into their opening game at the Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday . Hosts hope to see off stiff competition to claim continental glory . Achraf Hakimi returns from injury for Morocco .

Title: Indomie clarifies NAFDAC alert, assures Nigerians of product safety
Summary: Indomie Nigeria has dismissed reports suggesting that its noodles are affected by a recent safety alert issued by the National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC) The company described the claims as misleading and inaccurate .

Title: Nollywood cinema releases that stood out in 2025
Summary: This year, some films became unmissable . Even if you didn't catch them right away, you heard about them at work, in church, on social media, or during casual chats . These films filled theatres, dominated conversations, and showed that true popularity was high .

Title: Again, troops of operation HADIN KAI Kill 17 terrorists in coordinated ambush
Summary: Troops of Operation HADIN KAI neutralised 17 terrorists during a coordinated long-range ambush in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State .

Title: Arewa Youth Assembly rejects disputed tax law, questions legislative process
Summary: Arewa Youth Assembly (AYA) has rejected the recently gazetted tax law introduced by the Federal Government . It raised concerns over alleged discrepancies between the version passed by the National Assembly and the one officially published .

Title: How 50 kobo triggered first students protest in Nigeria
Summary: The demonstration, dubbed the ‘Ali Must Go’ protests, altered the landscape of student activism and youth resistance in Nigeria . The demonstration was dubbed the 'Ali Must go' protests .

Title: NDLEA nabs wanted female drug kingpin in Lagos with 23.5kg Cocaine hidden in children’s room
Summary: Operatives of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency have arrested a wanted female drug kingpin, Shodunke Yetunde Simbiat . They recovered 23.5kg of cocaine concealed in her children’s room at her Lagos residence .

Title: US, Nigeria sign $2.1bn deal to strengthen health care
Summary: Washington announced Saturday that it has signed a deal to strengthen Nigeria's health system . The deal is a sign of improving ties with Africa's most populous nation . President Donald Trump denounced attacks against Christians there .

Title: Anglican Bishop urges govt action to improve rural welfare, curb urban migration
Summary: Bishop of the Anglican Missionary Diocese of Oyo South, Rt. Revd Olufemi Familoni has urged governments at all levels to prioritise the welfare of rural dwellers . He warned that continued neglect of rural communities could intensify urban migration and create wider social and humanitarian challenges . The pioneer bishop said the

Title: Publish certified copies of tax laws from NASS, SERAP urges Tinubu
Summary: Socio-Economic Rights and Accountability Project has written to President Bola Tinubu . It urged him to publish certified true copies of the tax bills received from the National Assembly and the tax laws signed into law . The group made the request in a Freedom of Information letter dated December 20, 2025 .

Title: Makinde to sign N892bn 2026 appropriation bill Monday
Summary: Oyo State Governor, Seyi Makinde, will sign the 2026 Appropriation Bill of N892 billion into law on Monday . This was contained in a statement issued by his Special Adviser on Media, Sulaimon Olarenwaju . Budget signing ceremony will be held at the Executive Council Chambers of the Governor’

Title: NDLEA arrests suspected female drug kingpin, recovers cocaine worth N5bn
Summary: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency has arrested a suspected key member of a cocaine trafficking syndicate previously dismantled in Lagos and Ogun states . Title: ASUU gifts 31 OOU students N6.2m in scholarships
Summary: Academic Staff Union of Universities, Olabisi Onabanjo University chapter, has awarded scholarships worth N6.2m to 31 indigent students of the institution .
